text: Ohhhh! Congratulations!!!
Fantastic news!
when is the interview? do you already know more about it?
Thank youu :blush:
So it's a digital interview on website called hire view
oh? haven't heard about that before
They said it'll be a competency based interview with the last few questions relating to the role
So I did a practice interview last night and it's like having a blank screen with a question on and you have two mins to answer it. The answer is video recorded on the website
interesting
great that you already did a practice round
It's weird because you don't know where to look so I come across as distracted. And also since I tend to look up whiles thinking it doesn't help :sweat_smile:
Yes but the practice round has nothing to do with the actual one
I think that's fine
The practice is only for me to get a feel of the interface
I don't know..  I'm really worried..
when I interview candidates, one key thing I look out for is if they smile. not pretending to smile but a genuine smile.
Wow okay I didn't think you interviewed candidates.. Oops sorry
a "I'm happy to be here and happy to have the chance to present myself. And I'm not a grumpy person who's not fun to work with."
ha, no worries :smile:

By smile you mean a smile before I start and after I finish right??
Cause I don't think I can remember to smile while talking
yeah
but don't worry!
Haha that brought giggle :joy::joy: but I get the point.
But I've never done an interview before :sob::sob:
Not even in person
Except for when I applied for head girl at my school but that's it
I can do a practice round with you if you want
take 20-30 minutes and ask you questions via slack
Yes pleaseee!
sure :slightly_smiling_face:
when  is the interview?
It's due today midnight
I actually was given time till 17 march
But two days later they sent an email saying don't count the previously referenced date it's due on the 17 of Feb
oh
:see_no_evil:
okay, when do you have time today?
I have all day :sweat_smile:
It's school holidays
But I plan to record by about 5.00pm maybe? It's 10:15 now
What about you??
can you do 1pm-2pm?
I can try, yes
great, shall we say 1pm?
Yh sure
cool
can you please send me the link to the practice internview?
It's the same as the actual interview
Is it okay to be sharing that?
I think so
maybe?
not sure
I'll check their webstie
have you read <https://www.hirevue.com/blog/how-to-prepare-for-your-hirevue-digital-interview> ?

attachments.title: Video Interview Preparation: 8 Tips for Successful Video Interviewing
attachments.text: Whether this is your first, second, or fifth time performing a video interview, it most likely won't be your last. More and more employers are turning to video interviews to streamline their recruiting process and augment their hiring decisions.So what does this mean for you?
attachments.fallback: HireVue: Video Interview Preparation: 8 Tips for Successful Video Interviewing

text: double checking , that's the website rigbht?
some of it is a bit too much for you at this point - you don't need to have answers for everything and know all the details.
the interviewer knows you're just starting your career :slightly_smiling_face: just like everyone else had to :slightly_smiling_face:
Yup that's it
Oh phew!! I was like wow I don't know about what their prices (?) Work like and all the rest
What do you think I should know about the company??

• roughly what they are doing. 
• if they have products, be able to name at least one of them. e.g. a software that is used by clients.
• size of company & where they have offices (-> global company with global challenges?)
• if you have an idea which team you would join: roughly what the team is doing
• if you have any details from previous apprentices: how the apprenticeship is working
• why the company is better than other companies
okay so.
are you okay with starting?
Yh sure
Let's start
I would say I post a question and you have 4-5 minutes to type your answer? that should be somewhere in the ballbpark of 2 minutes talking?
Yup sounds good
Cool.
Here we go!
(might not be the same for hirevue but in regular interviews)
How are you? How was your weekend?

I'm good, how are you? 
My weekend was alright , yours?
Good, thanks.
Tell me about yourself.
(I think it takes longer to type. Don't rush, feel free to take more time)

So I'm Janies Rosario. Currently I'm my last year in sixth form and am the deputy head girl at my school. Currently studying Computer science, maths, biology and economics. I decided to apply for a degree apprenticeship as it gives me a chance to learn and apply new skills to a real time tasks, keeping me a step ahead of traditional university students doing a similar degree.
That might be too short I don't know..
(I'll comment on your answer later :slightly_smiling_face: don't worry - all good so far)
Why do you apply for an apprenticeship here at Goldman Sachs?

Goldman Sachs is one of the globally leading firms in investment banking and management services. It has a strong belief in providing the best services and meeting all client's expectations and I share a similar belief when doing my work. I decided to apply to Goldman Sachs because it also provides all of its employees a platform to develop their skills and talents to thrive and succeed in the work they do in order to produce the best work they can to guarantee client satisfaction
Tell me about a time you worked in a team.

I volunteered to work for a charity called wings of hope. Where me and my friends organised events  in order to raise funds for our aim. To decide on how to raise funds I suggested holding an art sale as two of my teammates were very skilled in painting, allowing us to utilize the talents at hand. We used our starting funds which we collected from sponsors in our schools and families to buy paints and canvases which in the end resulted us in having seven spectacular paintings which were then uploaded on websites such as Gumtree and eBay. By selling these we were able to collect 50 pounds. This taught me to be a strong team player and also to comprise ideas.
What's your greatest strength?

I believe my greatest strength lies in my team work and communication. I have always preferred working in a group when completing a bigger project as it allows the progress to be more efficient as the members can be assigned to tasks that best suit them. I have a strong belief in my morals and my respectfulness ensures that I complete my work with excellence and integrity. Doing one of my a levels out of lesson has also strengthened my ability to work independently, however I do not hesitate to ask for help if there is a need that I cannot meet myself. I think these skills will be beneficial when working with the engineering division at GS as it ensures that I can learn and be of help within my starting days.
And what's your greatest weakness?

I believe my greatest weakness is being to critical of myself and my work. This often results in me taking longer to complete a project, although I have never missed a deadline. However being overly critical of my work improves it's quality and makes me give a lot more attention to details, ensuring that any mistakes are not missed due to any tardiness, hence reducing any delays that may be caused if these mistakes were carried forward.
What do you expect to learn in this apprenticeship?

I believe this apprenticeship will give me the opportunity to grow and develop my skills in programming, and allow me to contribute to a project that can make a difference in the way things work in the firm or even worldwide. It will also give me the chance to observe how technology is making a change and bringing a revolution towards sustainable economic growth and development especially in a firm such as Goldman Sachs. I also believe it will allow me to work with professionals that share the same motivation and and objectives as mine and with the leading technology that can change things as we know it today.
What do you want to do after your apprenticeship?

After the apprenticeship I hope apply the knowledge and skills I have learnt over the 4 year period to Goldman Sachs. The experience I will gain here will give a better insight into the world of finance and growth and I will be able to use this to have an influence towards the future of this firm.
Why did you choose to study computer science, maths, biology and economics?

I've always wanted to do something technology and computer science related while also having a keen interest in science. This resulted me in picking maths, computer science and biology. I picked economics as a subject that will allow me to try something new than what I have previously learnt and to expand my knowledge into different areas. I got an interest into economics after hearing my teachers talk about the growth of the economy and a firm's strategies. I think this combination is a good fit for this position because it ensures I have the required knowledge in computing and programming and also in the choices of a firm and its decision making.
Do you have any questions for us?
Yes, what are the steps forward after I become an apprentice here at GS?? Do I get the chance to be promoted to a different or higher position later in the apprenticeship??
Awesome!
that was a good round! I have to run to a meeting now. I'll comment on each of your answer when I'm back at my desk (in ~30 minutes)
First of all whatever impression you got through that you should probably lower it a little because as it was typed I didn't have any stuttering :sweat_smile::sweat_smile:
Yay yh sure! Good luckk!
Thanks a lot for this
you're welcome :slightly_smiling_face:
good. always try to answer in a positive way and ask the interview how he is.

This is a very common question. It's a good idea to have an answer ready and rehearsed.

A bit longer would be good. Maybe add some more details about being the deputy head girl?  Maybe repeat some more things from the cover letter you wrote why you want to go into computer science? Mention the project you worked on?

"...I share a similar belief when doing my work." -> try to add an example to show them you don't just say this.

"... I share a similar belief when doing my work. For example when working on project X I did ..."


Last part is also good. Be concrete if you know about examples from other employees.
first of all, awesome! great initiative!
good answer with a great example. maybe add another sentence about how you worked together as a team.

try not to use too many buzzwords. better to focus on one or two core strengths that will benefit GS. also again try to add proof what you say with an example.

"I'm really good at X. When I was doing Y, X allowed me to ...."

"although I have never missed a deadline" good.

It's a good idea to mention a minor related weakness and then to say that it's not an issues because of X or that you are working on improving your weakness by doing Y. don't be too negative here :slightly_smiling_face:

And don't try to say something funny like "Chocolate". That doesn't work :smile:
good. again, if you have an example project you would like to work on or something they did in the past, mention it.

if you want, you can also add something along the lines of  "I'm just starting my career but I hope to gain experience over the next years to then make a valuable impact in a team. There are so many interesting areas and projects GS is working on like X, Y, Z, I'm sure there will be plenty of teams I can join to help."
good :slightly_smiling_face:
great. have at least one question ready for them, ideally something that shows long term, genuine  interest. just like what you just did!
Okay so the BIGGEST  issue I have here is remember everything. Usually I'm good at remembering but it just seems to be lost now:woman-facepalming::woman-facepalming:

I tend to forget what to say so it takes me a WHILE TO formulate an answer 
Especially given then I get  really anxious :sob:

I've commented on all the answers. In general it's already good. the only thing you might improve is to mention more examples. not just say that "I'm a team leader." but "There was this project we worked on in a team but we couldn't agree. So I stepped forward and ..."
don't worry! you can have a small cheat sheet in front of you (next to the display or something) with keywords about GS

Yes I'll work on that.
Mentioning examples when I mention a skill in a non skill based question, right?

and for the rest, don't worry and try to relax. take your time to answer the question. better to think about it for 15 seconds and then have a good answer than to answer straight away with a crap answer
Okay I need to go make that cheat sheet :joy:
xD
So is it okay if I stop for a couple of seconds between my two mins to think of something..???
And yes, even on a non skill question, try to add examples.
yes it is okay to wait!
not for a whole minute but definitely for a couple :slightly_smiling_face:
Okay that makes me feel a little better cause the silence stressed me out so much
no that's fine :slightly_smiling_face:
What did you mean by a minor related weakness??

it doesn't look good if you mention something serious. like "I don't like people. I have no interest in talking to them.". that'll be the end :smile:
and if you mention something that is not related, it doesn't really answer the question or it shows that you don't know what the job is about. like "I'm not good at identifying ice cream flavours".

so you want to mention something that is related to the job but nothing that makes the interviewer want to leave. something small that one can excuse and something you're actively working on
Alright.. so what I mentioned previously is okay?
yes
I'm almost ready to start
I'm a huge nervous wreck thoo!! :sob::sob::sob::sob:
sorry, been in meetings
did you start?
I'm doing the practice
Have to say it's not going great
why?
I keep fumbling..:sob::sob:
don't worry! take a step back, don't think about the interview for half an hour or so, go for a run, and then come back relaxed.
you did a great job when you answered my questions
sorry, I have to go now
That's alright thanks a lot

I'm sure you'll do a great interview! try to be relaxed and happy :slightly_smiling_face: you've done a great job earlier! if you struggle with a questions - don't panic! take your time! you have time!
good luck!!!
Thank youu
Idk I think I'm just going to take a break
yes
I'm way too worried to be doing this now
take a break, breathe and relax
